1.title: The Intransigence of Love
1.plot: Jimmy and Gretchen tell the story of their relationship to prospective wedding planners.

2.title: The Pin in My Grenade
2.plot: Jimmy and Gretchen reveal that they're forgoing a traditional wedding, opting instead for a Courthouse elopement.

3.title: The One Thing We Don't Talk About
3.plot: Jimmy challenges Gretchen to tackle some of the responsibilities that come with being an adult.

4.title: What Money?
4.plot: Jimmy unexpectedly receives a large advance and must fend off all his "friends" who just want a piece of the pie.

5.title: A Very Good Boy
5.plot: Jimmy tries to prove that despite being on the verge of becoming a married Hollywood screenwriter, he has not lost his bad boy edge; Edgar and Lindsay attempt to go on a real date.

6.title: This Brief Fermata
6.plot: Jimmy "gifts" Gretchen a week of no-strings-attached sex.

1.title: Pilot
1.plot: Jimmy and Gretchen find themselves falling for each other despite their better judgment.

2.title: Insouciance
2.plot: Jimmy attempts to take Gretchen on a date.

3.title: Keys Open Doors
3.plot: Gretchen inadvertently asks Jimmy for a key to his house.

4.title: What Normal People Do
4.plot: Gretchen makes Jimmy come over to her disaster of an apartment.

5.title: Sunday Funday
5.plot: Jimmy begrudgingly joins Gretchen, Edgar, and Lindsay on a "Sunday Funday."

6.title: PTSD
6.plot: After Jimmy accidentally sleeps with an A-List celebrity, he and Gretchen embark on a sex arms race to even out their score.

7.title: Equally Dead Inside
7.plot: Jimmy opens up emotionally, which completely freaks Gretchen out.

9.title: Constant Horror and Bone-Deep Dissatisfaction
9.plot: An episode spanning the course of nearly three years, we see the events that lead up to Gretchen and Jimmy meeting.

10.title: Fists and Feet and Stuff
10.plot: Jimmy and Gretchen take their relationship to the next level.

1.title: The Sweater People
1.plot: A newly co-habitating Jimmy and Gretchen avoid a life of domesticity by partying non-stop. Edgar obsesses over Lindsay while an oblivious Lindsay makes a desperate attempt to reconcile with her husband.

2.title: Crevasses
2.plot: The gang visit the mall so Gretchen can buy grown-up items while Edgar gets used.

3.title: Born Dead
3.plot: Gretchen makes an attempt to reconnect with her old group of friends by throwing herself a housewarming party. Jimmy does his best to affirm his belief that friends are for babies. Edgar continues his pursuit of Lindsay, and Lindsay meets her estranged husband's new girlfriend.

4.title: All About That Paper
4.plot: Jimmy spends the day with an eccentric author on a day-long job interview. Gretchen deals with a work crisis. Edgar discovers the magic of improv comedy. And Lindsay gets served with divorce papers.

5.title: We Can Do Better Than This
5.plot: Jimmy accepts a job novelizing television shows. Gretchen and Lindsay realize they have nothing interesting to talk about, except the men in their lives. Edgar meets someone special in his improv class.

6.title: Side Bitch
6.plot: Jimmy discovers Gretchen's been sneaking out of the house at night and suspects she's having an affair. Lindsay's life spirals as she discovers she doesn't know how to live on her own. Edgar takes Dorothy out on a date.

7.title: There Is Not Currently a Problem
7.plot: The group tries to get rid of a mouse in Jimmy's house; Gretchen finally opens up to Jimmy.

8.title: Spooky Sunday Funday
8.plot: Jimmy spearheads a Halloween-themed Sunday Funday.

9.title: LCD Soundsystem
9.plot: Gretchen becomes fascinated by a slightly older, cool couple that appears to have it all. Jimmy employs a punishment-based system to ensure he meets his writing deadline.

10.title: A Right Proper Story
10.plot: Jimmy's trashy family comes to visit from England, much to Jimmy and Gretchen's dismay. Lindsay finds herself with a job for the day. Edgar bonds with Jimmy's little sister.

11.title: A Rapidly Mutating Virus
11.plot: Jimmy gets closer to his bartender friend, Nina. Gretchen accompanies Sam to do a radio interview. Edgar attempts to make inroads with Dorothy's comedy friends.

12.title: Other Things You Could Be Doing
12.plot: Gretchen's depression comes to a head, forcing Jimmy to make a tough choice. Lindsay finally lets Paul go. Edgar has his improv graduation show.

13.title: The Heart Is a Dumb Dumb
13.plot: Jimmy attends Becca and Vernon's baby gender reveal party. Gretchen takes care of some unfinished business. Edgar and Dorothy's relationship reaches a turning point. Lindsay confronts Paul.

1.title: Try Real Hard
1.plot: Jimmy and Gretchen adjust to life after saying I love you. Edgar and Dorothy have sexual problems. Lindsay and Paul start a new hobby.

2.title: Fix Me, Dummy
2.plot: Gretchen starts therapy; Jimmy's confidence wavers; Lindsay neglects a bedridden Paul.

3.title: Bad News: Dude's Dead
3.plot: Gretchen enlists the gang's help to deliver some bad news to Jimmy so she doesn't have to albeit derailed by celebrating with an epic day-party. Lyndsey comes to terms with stabbing her husband and finds a way to convince herself she loves him.

4.title: Men Get Strong
4.plot: Gretchen helps Jimmy process a tragedy. Lindsay decides she wants to be a good mom.

5.title: Twenty-Two
5.plot: Edgar seeks relief from his PTSD.

6.title: The Last Sunday Funday
6.plot: The gang embark on a very special Sunday Funday.

7.title: The Only Thing That Helps
7.plot: Gretchen and Jimmy hold an unconventional funeral. Paul struggles to give Lindsay what she needs sexually. Edgar takes a stand against the VA.

8.title: Genetically Inferior Beta Males
8.plot: Gretchen parents her friends with mixed results. Jimmy does Vernon's podcast. Edgar embarks on an alternative therapy. Lindsay pushes Paul too far.

9.title: The Seventh Layer
9.plot: Vernon and Paul take a road trip.

10.title: Talking to Me, Talking to Me
10.plot: Jimmy builds a tree house. Gretchen accompanies Lindsay during a potentially emotional event. Edgar's professional life flourishes to Dorothy's dismay.

11.title: The Inherent, Unsullied Qualitative Value of Anything
11.plot: At a wedding together for the first time since the day they met, Jimmy and Gretchen's tensions come to a head. Edgar's relationship is jeopardized by his newfound success. Lindsay is forced to come clean to Paul.

12.title: You Knew It Was a Snake
12.plot: The three couples engage in day-long fights.

13.title: No Longer Just Us
13.plot: Jimmy and Gretchen investigate a murder site. Lindsay sees a new side of Paul. Edgar makes a sacrifice with unforeseen consequences.

1.title: It's Been: Part 1
1.plot: Jimmy has been living in a retirement motor-home community for the last 3 months. He spends his days watching old TV shows with his 71 year old malcontent neighbor Burt.

2.title: It's Been: Part 2
2.plot: Depressed Gretchen is hiding from her life and living with Lindsay who actually has a new fulfilling job. No one can find Jimmy. Edgar and Lindsay could be the responsible ones in the group now.

3.title: Odysseus
3.plot: After Jimmy returns to Los Angeles, he attempts to make amends with Gretchen, leading to their first confrontation. Lindsay and Edgar enjoy their new friends with benefits arrangement while Edgar tries to show Jimmy that Gretchen wasn't the only person he abandoned.

4.title: This Is Just Marketing
4.plot: Jimmy learns that his literary novel is being marketed as erotica. While doing Vernon's podcast, Gretchen realizes she's been letting Jimmy off easy. When Edgar and Lindsay babysit Tallulah, Lindsay learns for the first time that she's capable of love and Edgar tries a new technique to pick up women.

5.title: Fog of War, Bro
5.plot: Gretchen has moved back into the house and plays mind games with Jimmy, sabotaging his first interview for the new book. Seeing an opportunity in Gretchen's return to the house, Edgar and Lindsay plot to get Jimmy and Gretchen back together.

6.title: There's Always a Back Door
6.plot: Edgar takes Jimmy on a "man date" in an effort to emotionally bond with him while Gretchen discovers some startling news about the new guy she's seeing. Lindsay attempts to make friends at work.

7.title: Not a Great Bet
7.plot: Gretchen goes home for the birth of her brother's baby, but instead ends up reconnecting with a friend from her past who inadvertently reveals why Jimmy may have left her.

8.title: A Bunch of Hornballs
8.plot: Jimmy goes out of town for a book convention; Gretchen decides to throw a divorce party for Lindsay, leading to an unsuspected visit from Paul; Edgar's friend encourages him to overspend on party planning.

9.title: Worldstar!
9.plot: Lindsay's mom comes to town, shedding light on the origin of Lindsay's issues, while Jimmy attempts to get over Gretchen by hooking up with someone from his past. Meanwhile, Edgar struggles to reconcile his new writer life with his old veteran life.

10.title: Dad-Not-Dad
10.plot: Jimmy spends a day with a woman from his past and attempts to fit in with her friends while Gretchen attempts to impress Boone's ex-wife. Lindsay reconnects to a former father figure and Edgar, prompted by Max, buys a fancy car he can't afford.

11.title: From the Beginning, I Was Screwed
11.plot: Gretchen becomes a part of a family tradition with Boone and his daughter. Jimmy goes on an NPR game show. Lindsay's desire to help leads her back to Paul. Edgar attempts to make a deeper friendship with Max.

12.title: Like People
12.plot: Gretchen spends the day with Boone and his daughter in an attempt to distract herself from having slept with Jimmy the previous night, while Jimmy tries to prove to himself he's moved on. Lindsay attempts to save Olivia from getting too close to the unreliable Gretchen, and Edgar trails Max to figure out why they're no longer writing partners.

13.title: It's Always Been This Way
13.plot: Jimmy and Gretchen go for a long drive to force a conclusion on the confusing state of their relationship. Edgar finds closure with Max while Lindsay figures out a way to solve Becca, Vernon, and Paul's problems all at once.

imdb.title: You're the Worst
plot: Centers on two toxic, self-destructive people who fall in love and attempt a relationship.::Deadline
